Analysis: Perform correlation analysis to understand the relationships between variables and identify potential multicollinearity.
Visualize the distribution of each feature to identify outliers and skewed data.
Analyze the relationship between the target variable (MEDV) and each feature using scatter plots and box plots.
Check the distribution of the target variable to understand if it is normally distributed or skewed.
Explore the impact of the CHAS dummy variable on the target variable to see if it has a significant effect.
Handle outliers in the data by either removing them or using robust statistical methods.
Normalize or standardize the features to ensure that all features contribute equally to the model.
Check for missing values and handle them appropriately, either by imputation or removal.
Convert categorical variables (if any) into numerical format using techniques like one-hot encoding.
Split the dataset into training and testing sets to evaluate the model's performance on unseen data.
Create new features that might be more predictive, such as the ratio of rooms to the age of the house.
Aggregate or transform existing features to capture more complex relationships, e.g., combining NOX and DIS to represent pollution exposure.
Use feature selection techniques to identify the most important features and reduce dimensionality.
Apply polynomial transformations to capture nonlinear relationships between features and the target variable.
Consider interactions between features, such as the product of RM and LSTAT, to capture combined effects.
Try different regression models (e.g., Linear Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting) to see which one performs best.
Use cross-validation to ensure that the model's performance is consistent across different subsets of the data.
Implement regularization techniques like L1 (Lasso) or L2 (Ridge) regression to prevent overfitting.
Tune hyperparameters of the models to optimize their performance.
Evaluate the model using appropriate metrics such as RMSE, MAE, and R-squared to ensure it meets the performance criteria.
